date.headline: Craft beer with Ben and Friends
date.text: Ben Katz hosts an after-hours meeting of local technologists and policy-makers to kick-off a conversation about bringing open data to San Diego

date.headline: Code For America Presentation to City Council Committees
date.text: Jeff Johnson with the local Code for America Brigade makes presentations to City Council committees on Infrastructure as well as Economic Development & Intergovernmental Relations (ED&IR)

date.headline: ED&IR Committee asks IBA to prepare report.
date.text:
• Committee asks IBA to prepare report
  • Open San Diego / Code For America brigade presentation

date.headline: Draft Open Data Policy
date.text: Councilman Kersey releases draft open data policy based on NYC's Policy.

date.headline: IBA report on considerations of adoption an Open Data Policy.
date.text:
Recommends forming an Open Data Advisory Group and quickly hiring a Chief Data Officer.

Estimates an investment range of $150,000 (minimum) to $1 Million (robust)

date.headline: City Council Unanimously Adopts resolution R-308684.
date.text: Resolution declares that the City Council of the City of San Diego supports the creation of an Open Data Policy as well as formation of an Open Data Advisory Group to develop it.

date.headline: Open Data Advisory Group formed.
date.text:
Interim Mayor Gloria formed group via memo. The group is led by Jeff Sturak, DCOO Internal Operations.

City staff member participants from Council Districts 1 and 5, IBA, City Attorney, City Clerk, DoIT, Mayorâ€™s Office, and Performance & Analytics

Public participants from Code for America, OpenSan Diego, Port of San Diego, and local technical experts

date.headline: Open Data Advisory Group held six publically noticed meetings from January 21 to May 22, 2014.
date.text: With input from Huron Consulting and Sunlight Foundation, the group developed and proposed the policy and implementation plan.

date.headline: Mayor Faulconer creates the Performance and Analytics Department
date.text: Mayor Faulconer creates the Performance & Analytics Department and taps Almis Udrys as its first Director to implement efficiency, accountability, and transparency initiatives.

date.headline: ED & IR Committee unanimously approves Open Data Policy
Select Chief Data Officer
date.text: Maksim Pecherskiy hired as the first Chief Data Officer in the greater San Diego region.

date.headline: Vote on Open Data Policy
date.text: City Council unanimously adopts the first Open Data Policy in the City and the only one in the greater San Diego region.

date.headline: Written Guidelines on Preparing Inventory of Public Data Sets.
date.text: CDO will prepare guidelines to instruct departments how to conduct an initial inventory of data sets.

date.headline: Depts. Develop Initial Data Inventory
date.text: Upon Receiving guidelines on Preparing Inventory, each City Department will assemble an initial inventory of data owned or managed by department. CDO will compile this into a report by July 1, 2015.

date.headline: Initial Written Status Report
date.text: Within 180 Days of the effective date, CDO shall submit an initial written status report.

date.headline: Andrell Bower joins Open Data Team
date.text: Open Data team doubles in size when Performance & Analytics hires the City's new information coordinator

date.headline: Begin Publishing Data Sets
date.text: Within 18 months of the Policy Effective Date, or by July 1, 2016, the City will begin to publish high value Public Data Sets to its portal.

date.headline: CDO Submits Compliance Plan
date.text: Within 18 Months of the effective date (July 1, 2016), CDO submits Compliance plan; Recur yearly on July 1.
